etymologies: late 18th century: from French, diminutive of pale ‘shovel’, from Latin pala ‘spade’

definitions: a thin board or slab on which an artist lays and mixes colors.
shortDefinitions: board on which artist lays colours

definitions: the range of colors used by a particular artist or in a particular picture

examples.text: I choose a palette of natural, earthy colors

definitions: the range or variety of tonal or instrumental color in a musical piece

examples.text: he commands the sort of tonal palette that this music needs

shortDefinitions: range of tonal or instrumental colour

definitions: (in computer graphics) the range of colors or shapes available to the user.
shortDefinitions: range of colours or shapes available

definitions: a small flat case containing several separate shades of eyeshadow or other makeup product

examples.text: our Essential Eyes palette has eight mix-and-match shades

shortDefinitions: small flat case containing several separate shades of eyeshadow etc.
